overview: Dr. Dan Quinn is a Berkeley psychologist and therapist. (More about him at www.DanQuinn.Info). In addition to his private practice, he supervises the clinical work of doctoral students and teaches at The Wright Institute. he’s spent many years studying cognitive-behavioral, relational psychoanalytic, and a number of different humanistic approaches, and specializes in anxiety, depression and relationship difficulties. Iâ€™ve provided therapy in outpatient clinics, a drug treatment program, a university counseling center and an inner city school. I now very happily devote my time to my private therapy practice, corporate consulting in the areas of leadership development and teambuilding, and my highly satisfying work with my students. He is also leading a research team at The Wright Institute, studying the intersection of male role expectations and shame.
